info.title: Paperless Document
info.description: The Paperless Document API web service allows the users to upload their own customized trade documents for customs clearance to Forms History.

delete.summary: The Paperless Document API web service allows the users to upload their own customized trade documents for customs clearance to Forms History.

parameters.name: transId
parameters.description: An identifier unique to the request. Length 32

parameters.name: transactionSrc
parameters.description: An identifier of the client/source application that is making the request.Length 512

parameters.name: DocumentId
parameters.description: DocumentId representing uploaded document to Forms History.  Only one DocumentID will be accepted for delete request.

post.summary: The Paperless Document API web service allows the users to upload their own customized trade documents for customs clearance to Forms History.

parameters.name: transId

requestBody.description: Generate sample code for popular API requests by selecting an example below. To view a full sample request and response, first click "Authorize" and enter your application credentials, then populate the required parameters above and click "Try it out".

post.summary: The Paperless Document API web service allows the users to upload,delete and push to image repository their own customized trade documents for customs clearance to Forms History.

parameters.name: transId
parameters.description: An identifier unique to the request. Length 32

parameters.name: transactionSrc
parameters.description: An identifier of the client/source application that is making the request.Length 512

requestBody.description: Generate sample code for popular API requests by selecting an example below. To view a full sample request and response, first click "Authorize" and enter your application credentials, then populate the required parameters above and click "Try it out".

oauth2.description:
Find your client_id and client_secret on your app info page.
1. Once your credentials are entered select \"Authorize\" and a bearer token will be generated.
2. Click \"Try it out\" and enter any required values.
3. Select an example request to use or provide your own.
4. Select \"Send the request using the values above\" to execute your API request.

ShipperNumber.description: The Shipper's UPS Account Number.  Your UPS Account Number must have 'Upload Forms Created Offline' enabled to use this webservice.

DocumentID.description: DocumentId representing uploaded document to Forms History.  Only one DocumentID will be accepted for delete request.

DeleteRequest.description: Paperless Document API Request container for deleting user created forms.  N/A

RequestOption.description: Enables the user to specify optional processing. Currently, there is no optional process in Paperless Document API.  N/A

DeleteRequest_Request.description: Contains Paperless Document API deleted request criteria components.  N/A

DeleteRequest_ShipperNumber.description: The Shipper's UPS Account Number.  Your UPS Account Number must have 'Upload Forms Created Offline' enabled to use this webservice.

DeleteRequest_DocumentID.description: DocumentId representing uploaded document to Forms History.  Only one DocumentID will be accepted for delete request.

DeleteResponse.description: Paperless Document API response container for delete request.  N/A

Code.description: Identifies the success or failure of the transaction. Valid values are 0 = Failed and 1 = Successful.

Description.description: Describes Response Status Code.  Returns text of "Success" or "Failure".

ResponseStatus_Code.description: Identifies the success or failure of the transaction. Valid values are 0 = Failed and 1 = Successful.

ResponseStatus_Description.description: Describes Response Status Code.  Returns text of "Success" or "Failure".

Code.description: Warning code returned by the system.

Description.description: Warning messages returned by the system.

Response_Alert.description: Alert Container. There can be zero to many alert containers with code and description.  N/A

Alert_Code.description: Warning code returned by the system.

Alert_Description.description: Warning messages returned by the system.

CustomerContext.description: The CustomerContext Information which will be echoed during response.

ShipperNumber.description: The Shipper's UPS Account Number.  Your UPS Account Number must have 'Upload Forms Created Offline' enabled to use this webservice.

FormsGroupID.description: FormsGroupID would be required in Push Request if user needs to update uploaded DocumentID(s) in Forms History.  N/A

ShipmentIdentifier.description: Shipment Identifier is required for this request.  N/A

ShipmentDateAndTime.description: The date and time of the processed shipment. Required only for small package shipments. The valid format is yyyy-MM-dd-HH.mm.ss  N/A

ShipmentType.description: Valid values are: 1 = small package, 2 = freight.  N/A

PRQConfirmationNumber.description: PRQ Confirmation being specified by client. Required for freight shipments.  N/A

TrackingNumber.description: UPS Tracking Number associated with this shipment. Required only for small package shipment.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest.description: Paperless Document API request container for push to Image Repository.  N/A

RequestOption.description: Enables the user to specify optional processing. Currently, there is no optional process in Paperless Document API.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_Request.description: Contains Paperless Document API PushToImageRepository request criteria components.  N/A

Request_RequestOption.description: Enables the user to specify optional processing. Currently, there is no optional process in Paperless Document API.  N/A

CustomerContext.description: The CustomerContext Information which will be echoed during response.

Request_TransactionReference.description: TransactionReference identifies transactions between client and server.  N/A

TransactionReference_CustomerContext.description: The CustomerContext Information which will be echoed during response.

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_ShipperNumb.description: The Shipper's UPS Account Number.  Your UPS Account Number must have 'Upload Forms Created Offline' enabled to use this webservice.

DocumentID.description: DocumentID represents a document uploaded to Forms History.  N/A

FormsHistoryDocumentID_DocumentID.description: DocumentID represents a document uploaded to Forms History.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_FormsGroupI.description: FormsGroupID would be required in Push Request if user needs to update uploaded DocumentID(s) in Forms History.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_ShipmentIde.description: Shipment Identifier is required for this request.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_ShipmentDat.description: The date and time of the processed shipment. Required only for small package shipments. The valid format is yyyy-MM-dd-HH.mm.ss  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_ShipmentTyp.description: Valid values are: 1 = small package, 2 = freight.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_PRQConfirma.description: PRQ Confirmation being specified by client. Required for freight shipments.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryRequest_TrackingNum.description: UPS Tracking Number associated with this shipment. Required only for small package shipment.  N/A

FormsGroupID.description: FormsGroupID is a consolidated ID representing one or multiple DocumentID(s).  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryResponse.description: Paperless Document API response container for Push To Image Repository request.  N/A

PushToImageRepositoryResponse_FormsGroup.description: FormsGroupID is a consolidated ID representing one or multiple DocumentID(s).  N/A

ShipperNumber.description: The Shipper's UPS Account Number.  Your UPS Account Number must have 'Upload Forms Created Offline' enabled to use this webservice.

UploadRequest.description: Paperless Document API Request container for uploading User Created Forms.  N/A

RequestOption.description: Enables the user to specify optional processing. Currently, there is no optional process in Paperless Document API.  N/A

UploadRequest_Request.description: Contains Paperless Document API upload request criteria components.  N/A

UploadRequest_ShipperNumber.description: The Shipper's UPS Account Number.  Your UPS Account Number must have 'Upload Forms Created Offline' enabled to use this webservice.

UserCreatedFormFileName.description: The name of the file.  N/A

UserCreatedFormFile.description: The user created form file.  The maximum allowable size of each file is restricted to 10 MB.                                                                                                                                                                                                         Note: The maximum allowable size of each file is restriced to 1MB in CIE (Customer Integration Environment).

UserCreatedFormFileFormat.description: The UserCreatedForm file format.  The allowed file formats are bmp, doc, gif, jpg, pdf, png, rtf, tif, txt and xls. The only exceptions for having file format of length 4 character are docx and xlsx. All other file formats needs to be of length 3.

UserCreatedFormDocumentType.description: The type of documents in UserCreatedForm file.  The allowed document types are 001 - Authorization Form, 002 - Commercial Invoice, 003 - Certificate of Origin, 004 - Export Accompanying Document, 005 - Export License, 006 - Import Permit, 007 - One Time NAFTA, 008 - Other Document, 009 - Power of Attorney, 010 - Packing List, 011 - SED Document, 012 - Shipper's Letter of Instruction, 013 - Declaration. The total number of documents allowed per file or per shipment is 13. Each document type needs to be three digits.

UploadRequest_UserCreatedForm.description: The container for User Created Form. The container holds the file. Total number of allowed files per shipment is 13.  N/A

UserCreatedForm_UserCreatedFormFileName.description: The name of the file.  N/A

UserCreatedForm_UserCreatedFormFile.description: The user created form file.  The maximum allowable size of each file is restricted to 10 MB.                                                                                                                                                                                                         Note: The maximum allowable size of each file is restriced to 1MB in CIE (Customer Integration Environment).

UserCreatedForm_UserCreatedFormFileForma.description: The UserCreatedForm file format.  The allowed file formats are bmp, doc, gif, jpg, pdf, png, rtf, tif, txt and xls. The only exceptions for having file format of length 4 character are docx and xlsx. All other file formats needs to be of length 3.

UserCreatedForm_UserCreatedFormDocumentT.description: The type of documents in UserCreatedForm file.  The allowed document types are 001 - Authorization Form, 002 - Commercial Invoice, 003 - Certificate of Origin, 004 - Export Accompanying Document, 005 - Export License, 006 - Import Permit, 007 - One Time NAFTA, 008 - Other Document, 009 - Power of Attorney, 010 - Packing List, 011 - SED Document, 012 - Shipper's Letter of Instruction, 013 - Declaration. The total number of documents allowed per file or per shipment is 13. Each document type needs to be three digits.

UploadResponse.description: Paperless Document API Response Container for upload request.  N/A

DocumentID.description: DocumentID represents a document uploaded to Forms History.  N/A
